meanings.sent1: My pooch loves to play fetch in the park.
meanings.sent2: I saw a cute pooch at the pet store yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The little pooch wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: Her pooch was a loyal companion on all her adventures.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy pooch barked excitedly at the mailman.

meanings.definition: To bulge or protrude, as in a belly or stomach.
meanings.sent1: After the big meal, his belly started to pooch out.
meanings.sent2: The balloon began to pooch as it filled with air.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase started to pooch at the seams.
meanings.sent4: The fabric pooched awkwardly at the waistline.
meanings.sent5: The pillow began to pooch in the middle after years of use.
